guide.introduction: This is a relatively simple circuit, compared to other LED color organs, but is not a good starter project. Notice, however, that the pictures are for a custom ordered organ, which is significantly more complex. ignore the unexplained LED bargraphs, potentiometers, and circuit board. I know that the pictures are not posted yet, i will get to that after finals are over.

lines.text: One LM339 chip.  this is the heart of the color organ.  they are avaliable at radioshack and jameco.
lines.text_raw: One LM339 chip.  this is the heart of the color organ.  they are avaliable at radioshack and jameco.

lines.text: one blue, one red, and one amber 12V led module from superbrightleds.com  you do not have to use these, any LED 12V or below will work fine.  I like these for their power and price. (part #s MR16-B12-15-DI for blue, MR16-R12-15-DI for red, and  MR16-A12-15-DI for amber

lines.text: two of each: 0.22uf, 0.1uf, and 1uf capacitors.  i used 0.22uf and 0.1uf SMD capacitors to conserve space.
lines.text_raw: two of each: 0.22uf, 0.1uf, and 1uf capacitors.  i used 0.22uf and 0.1uf SMD capacitors to conserve space.

lines.text: three of each: 1k resistors, 470 ohm resistors, appropriate LED resistors.  i used 12V preassembled modules, so i did not need LED resistors
lines.text_raw: three of each: 1k resistors, 470 ohm resistors, appropriate LED resistors.  i used 12V preassembled modules, so i did not need LED resistors

lines.text: three 500k-1M potentiometers.  these can be anywhere from 500K (best with louder inputs, like an amplifier) to 1M (best with quieter inputs, like an ipod or mp3 player)
lines.text_raw: three 500k-1M potentiometers.  these can be anywhere from 500K (best with louder inputs, like an amplifier) to 1M (best with quieter inputs, like an ipod or mp3 player)

lines.text: input source and adapter (I used a male and female 3.5mm plug connected in parallel.  You will also need a 12v power supply, such as a wall wort and the appropriate adapter.

lines.text: solder everything according to the schematic.  I suggest building the passes and the rest of the circuit separatealy to conserve space.  doing it that way, i managed to fit the entire circuit (but with 3mm leds) into a jewelry box.

guide.summary: After watching Collin Cunninghams color organ videos, i wanted to build one, but didnt want to pay $40 for a standard version, or the well over $50 high powered digital version, so I designed my own, simple, cheap color organ.
